channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Grafton State Park Trip to be Held for Arch Summer Students
item.description: Date: Wednesday, August 7, 2024 11:00 AM - 4:00 PM - The Class of 2026 Council and Arch Ambassadors would like to invite current Arch Summer students to join them for a day at Grafton State Park to take a break from summer classes and relax! Space is limited, so please register; a free boxed lunch will be provided for every student who wishes to receive one.
item.author: Students

item.title: Fellowship Advisor Now Offering NSF GRFP Application Reviews
item.description: Date: Tuesday, July 30, 2024 (all day) - The NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Program provides masters and early PhD students in STEM fields with three years of salary and tuition. Beginning July 30, graduate and undergraduate students applying to the NSF GRFP are encouraged to email statement drafts at least one week prior to each discipline-specific deadline to receive formative feedback.
item.author: Students

item.title: CCPD Virtual Info Session with Crane Currency Rescheduled for August 8
item.description: In an event originally scheduled for July 25, students are invited to join the team at Crane Currency from 6:30PM to 7:30PM on Thursday, August 8 to learn about career paths and company culture within the organization, as well as upcoming opportunities for Arch students seeking an Away experience. Also review theChemical Engineering R&D Internship or Co-Op opportunity posted in Handshake!
item.author: Students

item.title: Tanglewood Music Center’s Fromm Quartet to Perform at EMPAC
item.description: Presented by RPI, the Tanglewood Music Center’s Fromm Quartet will perform “Storytelling and Memory” at the Curtis R. Priem Experimental Music and Performing Arts Center (EMPAC) on Friday, August 2 at 7:00PM, featuring works by members of Tanglewood’s composition faculty and co-directors of the Festival of Contemporary Music. Please register for free admission!
item.author: Community

item.title: “Leaders in Action” Conversation to be Held with Trustee Dr. John Capek
item.description: Date: Thursday, August 1, 2024 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM - During this session, hosted by Prof. Azita Hirsa, Trustee John Capek B.S. ’83, M.E. ’84, M.E. ’85, MBA ’87, Ph.D. ’88, retired Executive Vice President at Abbott Ventures, a global healthcare company, will discuss the intersection of business, entrepreneurship, and science and engineering. Participants will have the opportunity to ask questions related to the topic. Refreshments will be served following the session.

item.title: ISSS, COG to Hold Paris Olympics Watch Party July 31
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, July 31, 2024 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM - Whether you’re a sports enthusiast or just looking for a lively community event, join International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) and the Center of Gravity (COG) in DCC room 308 at their Paris Olympics Watch Party to witness the world’s best compete in the Summer Olympics! Light refreshments will be provided.
